required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Radiological Findings in Primary Intestinal Ischaemia
clinical_study.official_title: Preoperative Findings on Non-specific CT in Patients With Primary Acute Intestinal Ischaemia; a Case-control Study

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate which findings on a non-specific CT scan that predict acute primary intestinal ischaemia.

detailed_description.textblock:
48 patients with primary intestinal ischemia admitted in 4 consecutive years (2006-2009) in Department of Gastrointestinal Surgery, Aalborg University Hospital. Control group consists of 82 patients operated in the same department and in the same time range.
Abdominal CT scans are described with respect to intestinal diameter, changes in intestinal wall, extra intestinal changes and vessel pathology.

primary_outcome.description: Incidense of CT findings in the radiological main group called "Intestinal wall pathology"
Incidense of CT findings in the radiological main group called "Gastrointestinal vessel pathologypathology"
Incidense of CT findings in the radiological main group called "Intestinal diameter"
Incidense of CT findings in the radiological main group called "Extraintestinal pathology"

arm_group.description: Abdominal CT scan within 48 hours preoperative.
Abdominal CT scan within 48 hours preoperative.

intervention.intervention_name: Computerized tomography scan of the abdomen
intervention.description: Non-specific abdominal ct´s with different phases and contrast +/-.

study_pop.textblock: All operated patients at Department of Gastrointestinal surgery, Aalborg University Hospital, Denmark.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary acute intestinal ischaemia in an abdominal operation.
- CT-scan within 48 hours preoperative.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Secondary intestinal ischaemia
- Intestinal ischaemia isolated intestinal mucosa.
- No CT-scan within 48 hours preoperative

reference.citation: Menke J. Diagnostic accuracy of multidetector CT in acute mesenteric ischemia: systematic review and meta-analysis. Radiology. 2010 Jul;256(1):93-101. doi: 10.1148/radiol.10091938. Review.

Kärkkäinen JM, Acosta S. Acute mesenteric ischemia (part I) - Incidence, etiologies, and how to improve early diagnosis. Best Pract Res Clin Gastroenterol. 2017 Feb;31(1):15-25. doi: 10.1016/j.bpg.2016.10.018. Epub 2017 Jan 4. Review.
